website_summaries.verdict: Extremely effective; manufacturer offers a 100% guarantee. Safe for use on food crops. Depending on time of year, you get weeks to months of protection from a single application.
pros: Environmentally friendly: won't harm birds, bees, pets
32-ounce bottle of concentrate makes 2.5 gallons of repellent
cons: If deer are hungry enough, nothing may stop them, but at least you'll be able to get your money back if your plants are devoured by a famished buck

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, it Works!
customer_reviews.text: Tried them all and this is the one! I live in a deer infested area and have had all my plants, flowers, you name it destroyed for years. I gave this a shot and it works like a charm. I recommend spraying or everyday for the first two weeks just to drive it into their heads that this is what it's going to be, and then after that every 4 days or so. The trick is to change there habit and force them over to the neighbors yard😅 no need to reapply artist rain. By last summer I was down to one application per week.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be better than other like products
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be better than other like products. But nothing but shooting the deer will really stop a hungry herd. I find that the Scarecrow Water Stream is much more effective but you need both products to provide complete protection.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wein

customer_reviews.title: A miracle!
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by local landscapers, and it works. We have deer who will eat anything and everything. Have been fighting with them for years/decades. Tried all the foul smelling stuff. Tried everything I heard about. No good. Tried Deer Out, with incredible success. Really. Doesn’t wash off. Smells nice. Have to reapply only after few months - although it’s tough to tell, since you DO, of course, have to apply to new growth, which miraculously keeps appearing. Went away for 3 weeks, feared the inactivity would attract the deer, so applied fresh coat before I left, and not a single leaf or flower touched. I’m a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Sue E

customer_reviews.title: very effective for limited spaces
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for several years to protect flowers and outdoor pots in the front of my house. My home is in a semi rural-suburban area that backs onto a reserve loaded with deer. Most of my plantings are deer resistant - boxwoods, andromedas, etc. but I wanted to add color with some non deer-resistant annuals closer to the house. This product protects those annuals. ( For a few years the deer didn't eat my vincas but last year they were eaten if I didn't spray in time.) I have to spray every week and after every rain - but it totally works and I have no deer damage as long as I don't forget to spray.
customer_reviews.author: foreigncrimereader

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me one bit!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work one bit on deterring deer from late night feasting! I’ve sprayed 4 times in one week. Last night I sprayed every peddle, every stalk, every limb and even the underside of all my hostas and hydrangeas and woke up to nubs AGAIN! I included a picture of just a FEW that were eaten hours after spraying a fourth time in less then two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Turbotouch02

customer_reviews.title: It’s Working!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most, I’m stuck with the deer in my yard as we raise exotic deer and have about 20 in the yard. Over the past 10 years I’ve spent a lot of money on “plants deer won’t eat”. Ha ha! Even if they don’t eat them, they pull them out of the ground. The Deer Out along with a motion sprinkler is letting me have flowers for the first time. My plan is to invest in a fence before winter, but this is working great now.
customer_reviews.author: His

customer_reviews.title: Didn't repel my deer
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this deer repellent. I've used Liquid Fence for the past few years successfully on my plants, but I bought some Althea bushes that the deer are eating so thought I would try something that might work better. This product is not it. I sprayed a heavy coat on my plans in the morning and by that same evening I see several deer munching on my crab apple tree that they had never bothered before with the Liquid Fence. I can't believe it was same day treatment, no rain, and I had coated that tree heavily. So. Nope. It seems my deer like that nice peppermint smell.
customer_reviews.author: Niere

customer_reviews.title: So far so good....
customer_reviews.text: This seems to deter the deer. I put it in a sprayer and use twice a week. The smell is not overpowering and as I write so far so good. I failed to spray some newly planted Lilacs and the deer nibbled away. Nearby were sprayed acubas and they were left alone. True test would have been to spray one lilac and see if it was left alone. Wish it was a bit cheaper as it seems to be essential to save the plants from the hungry deer. Living in port townsend the deer have never known danger except an occasional car mishap and they eat everything in sight.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Usless as deterrent to white tailed deer in my neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fact I wasted 28.00 trying to protect over 200 dollars of purchased plants. Perennials or annuals neither are protected. Very disgusted. The deer population is dense in my area. I don't believe in homeowners having firearms, but I think that is the only solution to the deer problem. DeerOff is no help.
customer_reviews.author: kranf

customer_reviews.title: Seller sent order timely.
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this product. I called the seller and he said to be sure to spray the under sides of the leaves too. I tried this but I still have mixed feelings. It is expensive and I have many plants and I only get 2 uses out of this bottle. Most of the time it works okay but I think I may have to change because the deer seem to get "used to" these deer repellent sprays. Being an avid gardener I guess the deer is something I will always have to fight. There has been a lot of rain this season and it has contributed to loss of the plants because the repellent gets washed off.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sutton

customer_reviews.title: It works but need to apply more often than suggested.
customer_reviews.text: This product came with a seal that was never sealed. So when I accidentally dropped it from my waist carrying it to the garage it broke and everything came out. So I'm hoping the company sends me a replacement. Because this is an incredible product. You do have to apply it more than it states. But you do not have to apply an excessive amount of times. I have minimum 3 deer in my yard every day. I live on 6 Acres next to parks. Look at the picture of my hostas. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy G.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST deer repellent
customer_reviews.text: 100% the best deer repellent for day lilies, hosta, etc. Not sure if its good for edibles, but for ornamentals it's awesome. Really works. Deer are through our yard twice a day, like clock work. The LOVE hosta - it's like lettuce to them. They chew them right to the ground. I spray this on there and it last at least two weeks. But if I forget and go 3,4,5 weeks, forget it - they chew it right down again. 100% it keeps them back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It is effective.
customer_reviews.text: Dilute and spray on plants. Deer will not eat the plants. Re-spray after many heavy rains. Deer will not eat plants. The product effectively keeps deer from eating hostas and other tasty (to deer) treats. We have used the product for three seasons (summer 2018; spring and summer 2019) and our plants are intact. The only downside is that the product is a little expensive, but because it works, we are willing to pay the price. BTW, the smell is okay. I actually don't smell anything, but someone with a more sensitive sense of smell might smell something.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria King

customer_reviews.title: Deer Repellents
customer_reviews.text: Good product and worked well most of last year until mid Fall when there was some damage to hostas and lilies. Again in Spring as new growth emerged the deer seemed to eat despite Deer Out and new growth suffered. I reasoned that they became used to it so I changed to Bobbex and once again they are avoiding the plants I've sprayed. I have several bottles of Deer Out left and will use it again if the deer get used to Bobbex as I expect they may do. Both good products, likely best I've used along with coyote urine.
customer_reviews.author: Don01

customer_reviews.title: Works reasonably well
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this product. Over the summer, we have used this product weekly to keep deer away from our flowers. The scent, while strong, is certainly less obnoxious than other deer repellents. It does not contain blood proteins, so dogs are not attracted to it. It survives light rain but will need to be reapplied after a heavy downpour. After 12 weeks, the deer have not become used to this product, it still seems to prevent damage, All flowers have tolerated it without issue. We plan to use it again next season
customer_reviews.author: drbobstl

customer_reviews.title: Best Product
customer_reviews.text: I’ll always use deer out! It works! We live in northern Michigan and deer call it home too, I apply about every 3 weeks and we’re safe. It is expensive but if you want to save your flowers better invest in Deer Out. The smell is minty and very nice. Not sure why other reviewers are having problems it definitely saves our flowers. Thank you Deer Out.
customer_reviews.author: Marci

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Odor is very pleasant as opposed to the others deer off products. One big draw back is that it seems to wash off even after small rain shower, so you have to use more of it than the others. Found it works best if I hang a women’s feminine hygiene item in the bush or tree and spray it until it is saturated. Does wash away in rain
customer_reviews.author: David Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: Very Effective! I bought this after deer discovered the tomatoes in my backyard raised-bed garden. Applied it the day it arrived -- and did not have a problem with deer the rest of the growing season!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra D

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work against deer and dogs.  Effective against wives.
customer_reviews.text: I have been applying this to my newly planted bushes every other day for the past 2 weeks. Deer, apparently, does not read the label and keeps munching on the leaves regardless of my efforts and money spent. Same about dogs - trying to keep them off the grass, but the smell does not bother them at all. My wife is, on the other hand, hates the smell it passionately. Summary: do not waste your money unless you prefer to sleep on a couch (good news: taking extra shower helps)
customer_reviews.author: brumko

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have tried lots of others, and a few worked 'a little.' I kept trying one more thing, and bingo! Success! We live in a wooded area loaded with deer, bunnies, squirrels, and such. They were eating perennials this year that in the past had left alone. My flox, black eyed susans, and daisies were only nubs when we returned after a weekend away. Thought I'd lost them for good. It took about 3 weeks to recover and bloom again. I'm using it every two weeks for now, until the deer lose interest.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! After the deer have had their buffet on ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! After the deer have had their buffet on our geraniums, tomatoes, apples, and young leaves, this product is working very well. It is expensive but at least it works. And as one of the other reviewers said, you must SHAKE it well, every time you turn on the water to spray it. Shake, shake and shake again. It does clog the sprayer very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Garden
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed the Deer Off when my day lilies sprouted some green leaves in early spring. Sprayed when it rained heavily. Sprayed when the buds appeared and I did not have any deer damage either in my yard with hundreds of day lilies nor in the subdivision islands. Remarkable because a deer was born in the yard of one of the houses in the neighborhood. They were there but the Deer Off did the job. Last year I lost everything. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sushihippo

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work as stated.
customer_reviews.text: This product was not at all effective in keeping deer out of my garden. I mixed the concentrate according to instructions and applied it to my beans, cucumbers and squash every two weeks. The company claims you only need to use it every 30 to 90 days. This is not correct. Within a few days the deer were back. This product washed off after every rain and the deer were back the next night. I do not recommend this product to keep deer out of a vegetable garden. This was money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive & Useless
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this product, you'd better be prepred to spray your plants constantly and to spend a lot of money on this product ($39/quart). Their claim that it will protect for 3-4 months and will not wash off is disproven by the attached picture of what's left of my hostas after having been sprayed with Deer Out probably four times this seaon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hostas coming back and deer not visiting
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a home that sits next to woods and noticed the perenial hostas suddenly gone early in the summer. Read lots of reviews and chose this. My husband applies it more frequently than packaging says like others tell you to do. Hostas are now growing back and the usual herd of deer are not seen. They used to lurk in the woods in pm and come out to dine in the am. My dog is a barker but that didn't faze them, however, Deer Out did.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Fox

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how well this works. I have a deer and a fawn that were living in my yard. I started using this and have had no damage to any of my scrubs or flowers since. The rabbits are leaving everything alone as well. I wish I would have found this years ago. It does not wash off after a rain unlike rabbit spray. All you need to do is spray the new growth. I will never be without this again.
customer_reviews.author: N K O

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: These deer were pruning my brand new shrubs of all their new growth. This video shows the product working after 1 application. This is 3 weeks after I applied it, still going strong! (No rain but I have rinsed the plants once since then). It works and my new plants have bounced back! Applied at the recommended dilution in the evening. No leaf burn and no other issues. I will definitely be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A major waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Deer were chowing down on my tomato plants every night. Bought this over-priced elixir hoping to see some good results. Followed the directions and finally got the plants covered. This was a feat in itself because the stuff constantly clogged my sprayer. Got them covered and set up my game camera to see what happens. The deer STILL chewed the plants, the only difference being is that the deer had minty fresh breath! Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia H.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Scent, The Deer Love It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for three new willow bushes I planted. A jug of this cost almost as much as my 3 willows, but if was going to keep the deer from eating them it was worth it. It didn't. I applied it liberally and more frequently than called for, but there's hardly a leaf left on the willows, and even the branches have been chomped. This stuff smells pleasant enough, and it's easy to use, it just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: rather then deer out it is deer in
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product the first time reading the reviews however I was very disappointed when I used it in Bergen county nj. Deer ate the shrubs and roses that I was trying to protect. At the beginning , I used every day it was the third day deer ate the shrubs and the rose. Please don't waste your money buying this expensive product.IT DOESN"T WORK
customer_reviews.author: avo

customer_reviews.title: Packaging sucks, product works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past In a ready to use spray bottle. Decided to buy the concentrate.....mistake. After opening it, I put the lid back on securely, grabbed it by the lid to move it and the lid came right off and to the floor went the container. My garage now has a nice minty smell that I can’t get rid of. The bottle design and lid need to be redone so they stay on like most consumers expect. Trust me, there is not enough threads on the bottle for the lid to ever be secure.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Backer

customer_reviews.title: Dissipated Quickly
customer_reviews.text: After reading that a recommendation that a homeowner change deer repellents periodically for maximum effectiveness, I switched to Deer Out from Deer Stopper, with which had been very satisfied. I have been using Deer Out this summer and have experienced frequent deer damage within a few days of application. We have been experiencing heavier than normal rains where we live, but even when the rain has been minimal, the deer are not deterred. Because I must apply the product much more frequently, I have given only one star for value.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this 2 times, because I finally found a product that works. Because it is concentrate, the bottle lasts me 2 summers. I spray liberally on my flowering shrubs at least 2 times a week, consistently, and no munching by deer is noticed. They really dislike the mint. For me, the smell is not overpowering at all. I just put a little in a spray bottle and fill with water. It’s great. I think deer are creatures of habit as well: they know the shrubs have mint smell so they go elsewhere. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: Every year the deer decimate my hostas and day lilies. Not this year! I can’t believe how well it works. I use it much more often than it states. At least weekly and after heavy rain. Last year I followed the directions and ended up with everything being eaten to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Roma

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first but I used this product on my new landscaping that consists of flowers, shrubs and trees over three months ago. So far absolutely no issues with any animals coming through and eating or messing with the landscaping. My neighbors are always complaining about deer coming through but either I’m very lucky or this product is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Camardo

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow!!! It is actually working. ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow!!! It is actually working. I live up against 15 acres of woods. The deer feast in my back yard and eat anything growing above ground. They are prone to even eat branches on my weeping trees, hazelnut trees, bushes, etc. I have been using this product for going on 3 months. Not even a nibble!!!
customer_reviews.author: daniel fels

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Stop the Deer.
customer_reviews.text: I used this in our garden to keep out the deer from destroying beans and red beets. Followed mixing directions that were on the label. I was not impressed since the next day I saw hoof prints right next to the eaten plants. May work for rabbits and smaller animals but in my case, I won't purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: J Squared

customer_reviews.title: Great deer deterrent!
customer_reviews.text: Tried garlic and Irish Spring, but they washed away. Wanted something more lasting. A relative had used and recommended Deer Out. We tried it and it's still working after two heavy rainstorms. Application is easy with a sprayer, and because it lives up to the claim that it doesn't wash away, it's more economical. There's an initial mild but inoffensive odor that quickly disappears. Only the deer will notice it after it dries. Best of all, since a single application six weeks ago, the deer have completely avoided the plants they normally devastate -- including hosta, peach, blueberries, and vegetables. Until Deer Out, we didn't think that was possible!
customer_reviews.author: Popcorn Puppy

customer_reviews.title: To me it is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Deer repellents either work or they don't. This item was used in place of Liquid Fence which the deer began ignoring. It appeared to work for a while and then when my day lilies were about to bloom every one of them were eaten. I used the product exactly as directed and actually sprayed more often than required. To me it is a waste of money. I am now of the opinion that the only true repellent for deer is a well built fence.
customer_reviews.author: Whitley

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works for me
customer_reviews.text: This is the first product that keeps deer away from our flowers and bushes! and best of all it is the only product that I know of used for a Deer Repellent that only needs one application and dose not stink to high levels . It is easy to mix and apply with any hand sprayer. I have used this for 3 years and had great results!
customer_reviews.author: Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a garden saver. My entire garden was a deer buffet . Nothing was deterring them. I’ve sprayed this stuff 2x , once initially 3 weeks ago and once on the new growth, and I have had no deer damage whatsoever . I’ve been watering regularly as well . Has a minty smell. I’ll take that over coyote urine for sure . I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shore-gal

customer_reviews.title: Deer repellent, does it work?
customer_reviews.text: The scent was minty and because deer don't like mint it is a good deterrent. Spray your plant according to directions on the container. I feel I have had very good success with this product, it is not perfect because deer will try anything, but has kept them away from my seedlings and hostas. I am not that concerned about the deer eating my native perennials because they will continue to grow and flower (except cup plant and liatris). You need to remember to reapply this product, especially after rain. I reapply more than suggested on the container, but I don't want to see my plants mowed down by the deer the next morning. Very easy to mix and economical.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Roth

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! I live in northern New Jersey and deer frequent our front and back yard. They devoured my rose bushes. After applying this, my roses have returned and are thriving. Reapply it after heavy rains and/or reapply every two weeks. A bit of warning: the smell is strong and pretty gross, but it WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product would be wonderful because it says you only have to reapply a couple times a summer rather than after every rain like my old product. I applied it twice. I loved the minty scent. However, it doesn't work at all. I just discovered that the deer have devastated my hostas and phlox. There is nothing left. So I am still in search of something that actually works short of pulling all the plants out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t really work for me
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because while it may have deterred the deer some it did not keep them away or keep them from eating my plants. It did not stay active for very long and did not work after a rain. I sprayed and sprayed the same plants over and over to try to save them but I guess our deer are just really determined.
customer_reviews.author: BezNez

customer_reviews.title: This is the best deer repellent that I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deer repellent that I have ever used. It keeps the deer away for months! I don't even apply it as much as suggested, and it keeps the deer away from my plants. I like the fact that it is non-toxic, all natural and won't harm animals or pets. It has a nice, fresh minty scent. I guess the deer hate mint. I am a fan for life!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this deer deterrent for about a month and it seems to be protecting my roses and peonies from the voracious deer. I have been applying this spray more often than suggested because of the record rains we have been receiving and hope to be able to reduce how often the applications need to be applied during the summer months. The spray does has an odor when initially applied, but it is not offensive.
customer_reviews.author: LQ Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Stuff Works
customer_reviews.text: We live in Michigan with a heavy deer population. Been using this for three years now and nothing I sprayed has been eaten by deer. I spray once in the spring, twice in the summer and again in the fall. It’s not cheap but so worth the price. Doesn’t wash off in the rain either. There is kind of a minty smell for about a day and that’s it. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This product works. The deer come in at night and pull fresh branches off the willow trees to dine on. Then I am out there raking all the branches. After cleaning up under the trees three times I finally sprayed all I could reach. After it dries it lasts after it rains. Thankful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is just the bees knees! I haven’t ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is just the bees knees! I haven’t had a deer in my yard since I started using it. I pity my neighbors now that this little restaurant has closed and the deer have gone elsewhere to dine. I have only applied it once! Rain has not been an issue. I heeded everyone’s warnings about it clogging sprayers and emptied it out into an old milk jug til needed again and rinsed my sprayer out. Forget all other products, this is the last one you will ever buy!
customer_reviews.author: Susan E Page

customer_reviews.title: It worked in my yard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try to keep deer from eating my dayliles. They definitely don't like it. More than once, I have found mature petals on the ground that they apparently sampled, then spat out (pic attached). They seem to have done the most damage after it rained. So while it may be somewhat water resistant, it has been my experience that it needs to be reapplied after it rains. That said, I got to see all of my plants bloom this year. I will buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: LeahShmeah

customer_reviews.title: Works - But you need to vary
customer_reviews.text: This product is effective in deterring the deer in my yard, but only for a few months. After a while, the deer seem to figure out that the scent is not actually a threat and come back. It seems to help if you switch to another product every so often to throw them off and then come back. Of the products I have used over the past several years, this has been one of the most effective.
customer_reviews.author: LMSCHORR

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: I used it even more often than suggested and the deer still ate all of my plants that I spent hours tending to . I was disappointed beyond words when I woke up to find my hibiscus plant stripped of every leaf and its beautiful bloom. Waste of money and my time.
customer_reviews.author: Brown

customer_reviews.title: Vile Mint
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for over two years now and it works. We have an un-fenced postage stamp orchard which is under heavy deer pressure all year long. The spray lasts for about 4 weeks depending on how much rain we get. It may last longer than that but I error on the side of caution in order to protect my trees. The product itself is smooth with no clumps that could clog your sprayer and the scent is mostly mint with just a tinge of the sulfur brought on by the eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing less than a godsend! I live in the woods and deer are my enemy. But I get the upper hand with this! They will eat everything that hasn't been sprayed...but they won't touch anything I've put it on. I wouldn't be able to persue my gardening passion without this. It's a miracle!!! I added a photo of my plants that are going strong! This morning I watched deer graze on the grass all around my beds and they left my plants sprayed with Deer Out alone!!
customer_reviews.author: ljbarnes05

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing and, more than that, elevated me to hero status for saving my wife’s day lilies. Last year the deer decimated them, despite liberal application of a supposedly highly rated product. This year I applied this product and not a bud was touched. Phenomenal product and it doesn’t have the offensive scent that most others do.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Manion Lives

customer_reviews.title: Better fragrance for humans that other products.
customer_reviews.text: I have used multiple other brands over the years. Most smell bad to repel the deer, but repel the humans too. Not that this is sweet, but it is ok smelling. It does the job for deer too. The concentrate will last me a while, but I will buy this again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Les Hankerson

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while...
customer_reviews.text: We had thought we solved our deer problem using this brand. Worked well for 2 months. Unfortunately they have either gotten used to it or it washes off too much when it rains. I put it on one afternoon. That night it rained and by the morning $150 worth of Hostas had become deer salad.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL R GETTINGER

customer_reviews.title: Working for us for over 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: Been using for over 4 weeks. It has rained most of those weeks here in mountains. So far with reapplying after heavy rains, there has been no deer eatings on any plants. So happy since we usually have daily visits and cameras show we've had none.
customer_reviews.author: Sue E. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them away
customer_reviews.text: This stuff doesn't smell good BUT it doesn't smell like rotten eggs either... it's just an extremely strong peppermint but not in a good way. I can normally get away with every couple of months as the "locals" learn to avoid.. it's just when it weakens and new visitors arrive. BTW if you're wondering I live in Deer Run Sub which earns it's name.
customer_reviews.author: JDP4AN

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works! I spray on my lilies ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works! I spray on my lilies and Hostas once a week. The deer has not eaten yet. The deer comes every night because they are eating other plants. We have a big area and I can not afford to spray every where because this stuff is expensive. I only spray limited plants and has protected the plants and flower so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lata Misra

customer_reviews.title: Deer Out of my yard!
customer_reviews.text: It worked and does not stink ! Peppermint smell. Sprayed it several times when 1st used after "Liquid Fence" that failed and also stunk! A pleasure to spray. Seems to stay on good thru light rain. Once the deer know yours don't smell or taste good to them, they stop coming to eat.
customer_reviews.author: CROBINSON

customer_reviews.title: Deters Deer
customer_reviews.text: Used this on new plantings. Smells like peppermint and is better than Deer Away which is not very pleasing to smell. Since these new plantings were in the front of our house wanted it to be pleasant to the nose. We have a lot of deer and this has seemed to deter them from munching on the plants.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: It really keeps the deer away !
customer_reviews.text: It works like a miracle. I live in the mountains and we have lots and lots of deer. This product was the only thing that stopped my beloved deers from eating my plants. I only use once a month and my plants are now growing beautifully
customer_reviews.author: Radha Ananda

customer_reviews.title: Work if applied as directed. I do apply more often just to be sure.
customer_reviews.text: I have 18 roses that have been constantly eaten by deer till I purchased Deer about. I bought an inexpensive pump type spray bottle to apply product on both sides of leaves as directed and not one rose has been touched since with one exception. I had cut one rose way back and did not spray. It grew out and was ready to bloom, the deer chomped it but not one other rose was touched. I live in the Seattle area and even after a sturdy rain this still protects. I do apply about every 3 weeks just to be sure. I do not mind the smell but if one does, it’s gone after it dries.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This worked great to keep the deer out of my yard all summer. Will definitely order again!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: The only one that works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I live where the deer roam in such numbers that it is a rare day when you don't see them. This is the only product that actually keeps them from eating my ornamentals and veggies. It is also clear (unlike Plant Skydd), and smells like peppermint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't really do the job....
customer_reviews.text: It may have deterred deer somewhat but it definitely didn't stop them.... I applied 4 or 5 times over the course of 8 weeks, especially after it rained. As an example of its' usefulness....the last time I sprayed was a mid afternoon.... I got up around 6:30 the next morning and found a doe and 3 fawns munching away placidly on hostasI had just sprayed
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Great for flowers!
customer_reviews.text: The deer in my neighborhood are everywhere. They eat all our flowers. This product really keeps the deer away. But, the only problem is that you have to reapply it after every rain. If you forget, your flowers are eaten before you know it.
customer_reviews.author: Subjectus

customer_reviews.title: Works for about a week
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works for a week or so, IF it does not rain heavily. I use it up fast. I only have a few sun impatiens, ghompreena and mandevilla. I KNOW better than to plant a lot of deer delicacies. It smells awful - strong mint over garlic. If it "won't wash off", I have NOT noticed that feature as yet. Also, the new growth has not been sprayed, so the deer eat that. Some plants grow very fast during summer. Been using this for couple years. Have to spray over and over. It rains 100 days a year here. Saving up for a fence.
customer_reviews.author: health-wise

customer_reviews.title: Stinks perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is as good as the other brand. I switch between the two brands so the deer pay attention to the smell. We have herds of deer so I reapply every 10 days or so when I have a lot of young tasty buds and shoots on plants.
customer_reviews.author: Momterrific

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased similar products and they smell awful. This product has a mild mint scent. You must apply every three to four weeks or you will find out one day that overnight the deer have eaten your plants.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: Works with one exception!
customer_reviews.text: This product will work but there's a flaw: The purchaser must actually take the time to use the product! I'm telling you, Deer Out works to repell deer but you gotta get off your butt and apply it as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: This actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for 2 years to keep deer from devouring my garden. Just today I watched a doe stroll through my flower beds without taking a single bite! And the smell isn't too bad; I have a sensitive nose but I can tolerate this.
customer_reviews.author: A Hot Mess

customer_reviews.title: Deer out keeps DEER OUT!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Rochester Michigan in a HIGHLY populated deer area. I have tried a couple of different products that did not work AT ALL. This one WORKS! I mix it double strength to the directions and purchased the 1 gallon sprayer with it. This is the first year I actually have day Lillie’s. The deer are NOT EATING MY FLOWERS!
customer_reviews.author: L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Deer come through the yard now and walk right on past the plants I’ve sprayed. Pay no attention to blueberries, peas, or the rest of the garden. Can’t prove it’s because of this product but before I used it they were eating everything and now not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it does need reapplying
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's nontoxic and I can cover the parts of the plants that the deer can reach. However, it does indeed wear off and you need to reapply sometimes, also to new growth. I've gotten used to the smell, it's minty & not bad.
customer_reviews.author: brdygrl

customer_reviews.title: Jurys still out!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't spray for two days after rain for three days and the deer nibbled. Then I sprayed and now, 4 days later I find they got three hostas in the front yard. afraid to look and see if anything else gone. If I really have to spray every 2/3 days when we have sunny days and clear nights, I'm really throwing money away by buying this stuff. Just ordered a different brand since someone suggested switching back and forth. Is it really worth all this time buying plants, planting, spending money on spray to feed the deer. Might just give up and cut down and go back to ugly bare yard with no hydrangeas, coneflowers, hosta etc.
customer_reviews.author: lucionne holmberg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've used other product, but the deer got used to the smell. They don't like the taste of mint so then don't eat the plants. I used it every 6 weeks and everything was fine. I bought more for this season.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: We were worried about our flowers around our deck after removing our fence, so so sprayed the flowers with Deer Out. I’m impressed that it smells like mint instead of rotten manure like some of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: jps15839

customer_reviews.title: Very effective against deer in this area (Midwest)
customer_reviews.text: We have lots of deer living on or near our property here in Kentucky. It's not uncommon to see 6-8 wandering through our yard several times a day. We spray every 2 weeks and get absolutely no deer damage on hostas, petunias, berries, etc. I've tried other sprays, and this seems to be the most effective for the plants we're growing in this area.
customer_reviews.author: Jack W H

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, build a fence
customer_reviews.text: Someone forgot to tell the deer that they should not eat plants sprayed with this product, because they did - just a few days after spraying. Any amount of rain washes it off immediately. Useless and expensive
customer_reviews.author: Hiking Biker

customer_reviews.title: So far its working. Smells minty
customer_reviews.text: Have to at so far so good. I bought a new rise bush to honor my sister last year nothing stopped the deer from totally destroying everything. Planted the rose next morning all the buds were gone. I cured and came in to look for something to stop them found this product I liked the garrentee and that I didn't need to rush out after every rain. I am very happy and is concentrated so goes much further than most. I've seen deer but none are munching my plants so far. Thank you deer off
customer_reviews.author: melissa brown

customer_reviews.title: Best Deer Repelant
customer_reviews.text: I have used Deer Out the past 3 years with good luck. It lasts several weeks between sprays. I have many deer and will find eventually the deer will get at one or two plants but it is only about 5% of my gardens, so not horrible. In short, it has worked the best compared to other brands I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions!
customer_reviews.text: I like that Deer Out actually keeps the deer away from my plants. As long as it is sprayed thoroughly, and at least monthly as the directions indicate, our yard which is surrounded by woods, is deer free and my plants and flowers thrive!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly effective on the local deer
customer_reviews.text: The good news is that it is non-toxic, easy to mix, and easy to apply. The down side is that there deer in my neighborhood don't seem to be repelled by it. The manufacturer claims that it is long-lasting and does not wash off, but within a week of applying this to new plants, the deer had nibbled them down to nubs.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Tomar

customer_reviews.title: Deer out
customer_reviews.text: Repels the deer, elk and moose for our exposed flowers, the don't like the peppermint smell or flavor. Manufacture saws to sprat 1-3 months, where we live I spray every three to four weeks for great return on our flowers. Highly recommend this product, as I have used it now for about 5 years Ron
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: it isn't dependable
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this on my nasturtiums two days ago and this morning discovered that deer had eaten the tops off of all my plants during the night! After all my work in tending these plants - this is really heartbreaking!
customer_reviews.author: spenc and pat meier

customer_reviews.title: VERY EFFECTIVE DEER DETERENT
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for several years and have found it to be a very effective deer deterrent. The deer walk right along the sidewalk and don't stop to graze until they reach our neighbors yard.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work mildly offensive odor
customer_reviews.text: Noticed a few leaves missing off of my cucumbers have not touched the tomatoes however mixture explanation a little confusing seems mostly working so far had bad deer problem before possibly also keeping groundhog at Bay
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: and find it to be the best deterrent for deer I've come across
customer_reviews.text: Have used this in my flower beds for several years now, and find it to be the best deterrent for deer I've come across. It has a pleasant odor, unlike other products, and seems to last through rain storms. I have many Hostas in my garden and the deer absolutely love to nibble on the leaves. This keeps them away so I have a chance to enjoy a full season of the plants rather than having to look at stubble all summer long.
customer_reviews.author: Ree

customer_reviews.title: Smell is pleasant, apparently to deer, too
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use; clear directions; scent is mostly minty/herbal and not terribly unpleasant; however, it seems to fade very quickly, and it didn’t seem to do anything to keep deer away from our shrubs and trees. It seems like I would have to apply this more frequently than every few days for it to be at all effective.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly R Gerlach

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this worked, and worked so well. I found the smell to be a bit pungent, but not horrible. I wouldn't want to scent my home with it, but it wasn't gag-inducing. I also didn't have a sprayer available, so I mixed it up in an empty gallon milk jug and then sprinkled/sloshed it on the plants and around the bedding areas. This morning, all my plants were intact and untouched, unlike the previous two weeks' worth of evening dinner buffet action that the deer have been having. I hope it'll last for at least a few weeks without having to reapply it.
customer_reviews.author: TraceyinVA

customer_reviews.title: Deer food
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed the roses last night, blossoms gone in this morning. Put an apple by the roses and sprayed it with Deer Out and this AM it was gone.
customer_reviews.author: Hart

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the deer away!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy that the Deer no longer eat my flowers! I spray my garden about once a month and the deer still come in my yard, but they stay a about 10-25 feet away. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Susie J.

customer_reviews.title: Works well to repel deer
customer_reviews.text: This works well to keep the deer from eating all out plantings. If you are diligent to reapply after rain for about 3 weeks, the deer stop coming around to the sprayed plants and it isn't necessary to spray as often.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Carroll

customer_reviews.title: I live in the woods with a couple of acres of beautiful gardens. Normally
customer_reviews.text: Seems to really do the job! I live in the woods with a couple of acres of beautiful gardens. Normally , in the spring and fall, the deer have totally consumed my many hostas. This year, only one was munched on - perhaps I didn't spray it well. Also purchased the spray container which is, I feel, essential. Works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps away deer from whole property from day one
customer_reviews.text: Kept deer out of my yard since first time using it. I first did not apply anything at a fenced in section of my yard and thats where the deer went the following day, sure enough I mixed some more of the product and applied to that area as well (onto bush leaves)..no more deer at all since.
customer_reviews.author: WaterFrog

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its only been on 3 days, will update later Update: For me, it did not work. I soaked the leaves and stems, and that night the deer had a feeding frenzy. Buy bullets instead.
customer_reviews.author: PMM

customer_reviews.title: Saved my roses
customer_reviews.text: Planted roses, and they were immediately chewed on by deer. One treatment with this....no more problem. Lasted the entire summer season. Extremely pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L. Tyburski

product_meta.title: Deer Out 32oz Concentrate Deer Repellent
feature_bullets: Over 100,000 Repeat Customers - It Works Great!
Minty Fresh Scent - Smells Great to Humans!
Wont Wash Off - Two Natural Stickers keeps it on your plants!
All Natural ingredients - No Harmful Chemicals or Poisons!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,244 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
